newsitem.title: NEW ZEALAND: Countrywide cuts NZ variable mortgage rate.
newsitem.headline: Countrywide cuts NZ variable mortgage rate.

text.p: Countrywide Bank said on Thursday it was the first major New Zealand bank to drop its floating mortgage lending rate in a new round of cuts -- cutting it to 8.95 percent from 9.4 percent.
It cut its one-year fixed rate to 8.7 from 8.95 percent.
Countrywide said the change was due to downward pressure on wholesale rates.
However, general manager Bob Munro said volatility in markets made the sustainability of recent cuts uncertain.
AMP subsidiary Ergo, Hongkong Bank and Southland Building Society have all cut their floating home loan rates recently, to 8.25 percent, 8.4 percent and 8.95 percent respectively.
The main New Zealand banks' floating rates are all currently at 9.4 percent.
